title: Unexplained Deaths and Critical Illnesses of Suspected Infectious Cause, Taiwan, 2000–2005
textAbstract: We report 5 years’ surveillance data from the Taiwan Centers for Disease Control on unexplained deaths and critical illnesses suspected of being caused by infection. A total of 130 cases were reported; the incidence rate was 0.12 per 100,000 person-years; and infectious causes were identified for 81 cases (62%).
